Reason: The _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration is considered performance-sensitive. This is because the value passed to _transactionDeepCopyMode directly affects how transactions are handled in terms of deep copying, which can have a substantial impact on memory usage and system performance. The configuration is crucial for defining the transaction deep copy mode for the Prevayler implementation, and variations in this configuration can directly impact the system performance at the system level. Additionally, the configuration is passed as a parameter to the constructor of PrevaylerImpl class when creating a Prevayler instance, indicating its importance in the system's functionality.
